RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by shortening or condensing the original resource but leaving the nature and content of the original resource substantially unchanged.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by shortening or condensing the original work but leaving the nature and content of the original work substantially unchanged. For substantial modifications that result in the creation of a new work, see author

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by acting as a cast member or player in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by acting as a cast member or player in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent to whom a resource or part of a resource is addressed.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization to whom the correspondence in the work is addressed

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a moving image resource or computer program by giving apparent movement to inanimate objects or drawings.
MRC definition: A person contributing to a moving image work or computer program by giving apparent movement to inanimate objects or drawings. For the creator of the drawings that are animated, see artist

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who makes manuscript annotations on a resource.
MRC definition: A person who makes manuscript annotations on an item

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who appeals a lower court?s decision.
MRC definition: A person or organization who appeals a lower court's decision

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent against whom an appeal is taken.
MRC definition: A person or organization against whom an appeal is taken

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating an architectural design, including a pictorial representation intended to show how a building, etc., will look when completed.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating an architectural design, including a pictorial representation intended to show how a building, etc., will look when completed. It also oversees the construction of structures

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a musical resource by rewriting the composition for a medium of performance different from that for which the resource was originally intended.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a musical work by rewriting the composition for a medium of performance different from that for which the work was originally intended, or modifying the work for the same medium of performance, etc., such that the musical substance of the original composition remains essentially unchanged. For extensive modification that effectively results in the creation of a new musical work, see composer

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by overseeing the artists and craftspeople who build the sets for moving image productions.
MRC definition: A person contributing to a motion picture or television production by overseeing the artists and craftspeople who build the sets

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a resource by conceiving, and often implementing, an original graphic design, drawing, painting, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work by conceiving, and implementing, an original graphic design, drawing, painting, etc. For book illustrators, prefer Illustrator [ill

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a resource that is primarily textual in content, regardless of media type (e.g., printed text, spoken word, electronic text, tactile text) or genre (e.g., poems, novels, screenplays, blogs).
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work that is primarily textual in content, regardless of media type (e.g., printed text, spoken word, electronic text, tactile text) or genre (e.g., poems, novels, screenplays, blogs). Use also for persons, etc., creating a new work by paraphrasing, rewriting, or adapting works by another creator such that the modification has substantially changed the nature and content of the original or changed the medium of expression

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent whose manuscript signature appears on a resource.
MRC definition: A person whose manuscript signature appears on an item

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who binds a resource.
MRC definition: A person who binds an item

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by being responsible for the entire graphic design of a book, including arrangement of type and illustration, choice of materials, and process used.
MRC definition: A person or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by being responsible for the entire graphic design of a book, including arrangement of type and illustration, choice of materials, and process used

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by embossing braille cells using a stylus, special embossing printer, or other device.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by embossing Braille cells using a stylus, special embossing printer, or other devic

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in broadcasting a resource to an audience via radio, television, webcast, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in broadcasting a resource to an audience via radio, television, webcast, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a map, atlas, globe, or other cartographic resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a map, atlas, globe, or other cartographic work

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by pouring a liquid or molten substance into a mold and leaving it to solidify to take the shape of the mold.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by pouring a liquid or molten substance into a mold and leaving it to solidify to take the shape of the mold

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a resource of movement.
MRC definition: A person responsible for creating or contributing to a work of movement

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a curator who lists or inventories the items in an aggregate resource such as a collection of items or resources.
MRC definition: A curator who lists or inventories the items in an aggregate work such as a collection of items or works

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a curator who brings together resources from various sources that are then arranged, described, and cataloged as a collection.
MRC definition: A curator who brings together items from various sources that are then arranged, described, and cataloged as a collection. A collector is neither the creator of the material nor a person to whom manuscripts in the collection may have been addressed

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource of photographic prints from film or other colloid that has ink-receptive and ink-repellent surfaces.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of photographic prints from film or other colloid that has ink-receptive and ink-repellent surfaces

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by providing interpretation, analysis, or a discussion of the subject matter on a recording, film, or other audiovisual medium.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a work by providing interpretation, analysis, or a discussion of the subject matter on a recording, film, or other audiovisual medium

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a new resource (e.g., a bibliography, a directory) by selecting, arranging, aggregating, and editing data, information, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new work (e.g., a bibliography, a directory) through the act of compilation, e.g., selecting, arranging, aggregating, and editing data, information, etc

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a musical resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a musical resource by adding music to a work that originally lacked it or supplements it

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a musical resource by leading a performing group (orchestra, chorus, opera, etc.) in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a musical resource by leading a performing group (orchestra, chorus, opera, etc.) in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who provides consultation services, and often makes recommendations, for another person, family or corporate body that is represented as the creator of a resource.
MRC definition: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is called upon for professional advice or services in a specialized field of knowledge or training

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource. Contributors include editors, translators, arrangers of music, performers, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family or organization responsible for making contributions to the resource. This includes those whose work has been contributed to a larger work, such as an anthology, serial publication, or other compilation of individual works. If a more specific role is available, prefer that, e.g. editor, compiler, illustrator

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by designing the costumes for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization that designs the costumes for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a court governed by court rules, regardless of their official nature (e.g., laws, administrative regulations).
MRC definition: A court governed by court rules, regardless of their official nature (e.g., laws, administrative regulations)

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by preparing a court?s opinions for publication.
MRC definition: The person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by preparing a court's opinions for publication

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for the creation of a resource.
MRC definition: A person or organization responsible for the intellectual or artistic content of a resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent conceiving, aggregating, and/or organizing an exhibition, collection, or other resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization conceiving, aggregating, and/or organizing an exhibition, collection, or other item

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent currently having legal possession of a resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization that currently owns an item or collection, i.e.has legal possession of a specific copy or instance of a resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent having legal custody of an item.
Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by dancing in a musical, dramatic, etc., presentation.
MRC definition: A performer who dances in a musical, dramatic, etc., presentation

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent to whom a resource is dedicated.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization to whom the resource is dedicated

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent by whom a resource is dedicated.
MRC definition: A person who writes a dedication, which may be a formal statement or in epistolary or verse form

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who is accused in a criminal proceeding or sued in a civil proceeding.
MRC definition: A person or organization who is accused in a criminal proceeding or sued in a civil proceeding

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a corporate body granting an academic degree.
MRC definition: A organization granting an academic degree

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent overseeing a higher-level academic degree.
MRC definition: A person overseeing a higher level academic degree

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a current owner of a resource who deposited the resource into the custody of another person, family, or corporate body, while still retaining ownership.
MRC definition: A current owner of an item who deposited the item into the custody of another person, family, or organization, while still retaining ownership

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a design for an object.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a design for an object

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance, a radio or television program, etc.
MRC definition: A person responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance, a radio or television program, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent that captures images, either electronically or on film or video stock, and often selects and arranges the lighting. the director of photography for a movie is also called the chief cinematographer.
MRC definition: A person in charge of photographing a motion picture, who plans the technical aspets of lighting and photographing of scenes, and often assists the director in the choice of angles, camera setups, and lighting moods. He or she may also supervise the further processing of filmed material up to the completion of the work print. Cinematographer is also referred to as director of photography. Do not confuse with videographer

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent that captures images, either electronically or on film or video stock, and often selects and arranges the lighting. the director of photography for a movie is also called the chief cinematographer.
MRC definition: A person in charge of a video production, e.g. the video recording of a stage production as opposed to a commercial motion picture. The videographer may be the camera operator or may supervise one or more camera operators. Do not confuse with cinematographer

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for distributing a resource.
MRC definition: A person or organization that has exclusive or shared marketing rights for a resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a former owner of a resource who donated that resource to another owner.
MRC definition: A former owner of an item who donated that item to another owner

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by an architect, inventor, etc., by making detailed plans or drawings for buildings, ships, aircraft, machines, objects, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by an architect, inventor, etc., by making detailed plans or drawings for buildings, ships, aircraft, machines, objects, etc

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by revising or clarifying the content, e.g., adding an introduction, notes, or other critical matter.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by revising or elucidating the content, e.g., adding an introduction, notes, or other critical matter. An editor may also prepare a resource for production, publication, or distribution. For major revisions, adaptations, etc., that substantially change the nature and content of the original work, resulting in a new work, see author

RDA label: has editor of moving image work
RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for assembling, arranging, and trimming film, video, or other moving image formats, including both visual and audio aspects.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for assembling, arranging, and trimming film, video, or other moving image formats, including both visual and audio aspects

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a jurisdiction enacting a law, regulation, constitution, court rule, etc.
MRC definition: A jurisdiction enacting a law, regulation, constitution, court rule, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by cutting letters, figures, etc., on a surface such as a wooden or metal plate used for printing.
MRC definition: A person or organization who cuts letters, figures, etc. on a surface, such as a wooden or metal plate used for printing

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by subjecting metal, glass, or some other surface used for printing, to acid or another corrosive substance.
MRC definition: A person or organization who produces text or images for printing by subjecting metal, glass, or some other surface to acid or the corrosive action of some other substance

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a director responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance.
MRC definition: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in distributing a moving image resource to theatres or other distribution channels.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in distributing a moving image resource to theatres or other distribution channels

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a film.
MRC definition: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a film

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating an independent or personal film.
MRC definition: A person, family or organization responsible for creating an independent or personal film. A filmmaker is individually responsible for the conception and execution of all aspects of the film

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent formerly having legal possession of a resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization formerly having legal possession of an item (i.e., a specific copy or instance of a resource)

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent honoured by a resource (e.g., the honouree of a festschrift).
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization honored by a work or item (e.g., the honoree of a festschrift, a person to whom a copy is presented)

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) that includes other guests, performers, etc. (e.g., talk show host).
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) that includes other guests, performers, etc. (e.g., talk show host)

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a corporate body hosting the event, exhibit, conference, etc., which gave rise to a resource, but having little or no responsibility for the content of the resource.
MRC definition: An organization hosting an event, exhibit, conference, etc., which gave rise to the resource, but having little or no responsibility for the content of the resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent providing decoration to a specific resource using precious metals or color, often with elaborate designs and motifs.
MRC definition: A person providing decoration to a specific item using precious metals or color, often with elaborate designs and motifs

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by supplementing the primary content with drawings, diagrams, photographs, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by supplementing the primary content with drawings, diagrams, photographs, etc. If the work is primarily the artistic content created by this entity, use artist

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who has written a statement of dedication or gift on a resource.
MRC definition: A person who has written a statement of dedication or gift

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by playing a musical instrument.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by playing a musical instrument

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a resource by responding to an interviewer, usually a reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent.
MRC definition: A person, family or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by responding to an interviewer, usually a reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a resource by acting as an interviewer, reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by acting as an interviewer, reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a new device or process.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new device or process

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent, family or corporate body issuing a resource, such as an official organ of the body.
MRC definition: A person, family or organization issuing the work, such as an official organ of the body

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who hears and decides on legal matters in court.
MRC definition: A person who hears and decides on legal matters in court.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a jurisdiction governed by a law, regulation, etc., that was enacted by another jurisdiction.
MRC definition: A jurisdiction governed by a law, regulation, etc., that was enacted by another jurisdiction

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an architect responsible for creating landscape resources.
MRC definition: An architect responsible for creating landscape works. This work involves coordinating the arrangement of existing and proposed land features and structures

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an author of the words of an opera or other musical stage resource or an oratorio.
MRC definition: An author of a libretto of an opera or other stage work, or an oratorio

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by preparing a stone or plate for lithographic printing, including a graphic artist creating a design directly on the surface from which printing will be done.
MRC definition: A person or organization who prepares the stone or plate for lithographic printing, including a graphic artist creating a design directly on the surface from which printing will be done.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an author of the words of a popular song, including a song or songs from a musical.
MRC definition: An author of the words of a non-dramatic musical work (e.g. the text of a song), except for oratorios

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for printing, duplicating, casting, etc., a resource in a published form.
MRC definition: A person or organization responsible for printing, duplicating, casting, etc. a resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a person held to be a channel of communication between the earthly world and a world of spirits.
MRC definition: A person held to be a channel of communication between the earthly world and a world

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for recording the minutes of a meeting.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for recording the minutes of a meeting

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by coordinating the activities of the composer, the sound editor, and sound mixers for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.
MRC definition: A person who coordinates the activities of the composer, the sound editor, and sound mixers for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by reading or speaking in order to give an account of an act, occurrence, course of events, etc.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by reading or speaking in order to give an account of an act, occurrence, course of events, etc

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by appearing on screen to provide contextual or background information. an on-screen presenter may appear in nonfiction moving image materials or in introductions to fiction moving image materials.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by appearing on screen in nonfiction moving image materials or introductions to fiction moving image materials to provide contextual or background information. Use when another term (e.g., narrator, host) is either not applicable or not desired

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent having legal possession of a resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization that currently owns an item or collection, i.e.has legal possession of a resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by participating in a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by participating in a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by performing music, acting, dancing, speaking, etc., often in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.
MRC definition: A person contributing to a resource by performing music, acting, dancing, speaking, etc., often in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.ÿIf specific codes are used, [prf] is used for a person whose principal skill is not known or specified

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a photographic resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a photographic work

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who brings a suit in a civil proceeding.
MRC definition: A person or organization who brings a suit in a civil proceeding

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by preparing plates used in the production of printed images and/or text.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by preparing plates used in the production of printed images and/or text

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent who is the faculty moderator of an academic disputation, normally proposing a thesis and participating in the ensuing disputation.
MRC definition: A person who is the faculty moderator of an academic disputation, normally proposing a thesis and participating in the ensuing disputation

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent mentioned in an ?x presents? credit for moving image materials and who is probably associated with production, finance, or distribution in some way.
MRC definition: A person or organization mentioned in an ?X presents? credit for moving image materials and who is associated with production, finance, or distribution in some way. A vanity credit; in early years, normally the head of a studio

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource of printed text, notated music, etc., from type or plates, such as a book, newspaper, magazine, broadside, score, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of printed text, notated music, etc., from type or plates, such as a book, newspaper, magazine, broadside, score, etc

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent involved in manufacturing a resource by making a relief, intaglio, or planographic printing surface.
MRC definition: A person or organization who makes a relief, intaglio, or planographic printing surface

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for most of the business aspects of a production for screen, sound recording, television, webcast, etc. the producer is generally responsible for fund raising, managing the production, hiring key personnel, arranging for distributors, etc.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for most of the business aspects of a production for screen, sound recording, television, webcast, etc. The producer is generally responsible for fund raising, managing the production, hiring key personnel, arranging for distributors, etc.

RDA label: has producer of an unpublished resource
RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for inscribing, fabricating, constructing, etc., a resource in an unpublished form.
Relates a resource to a corporate body that is responsible for financial, technical, and organizational management of a production for stage, screen, sound recording, television, webcast, etc.
MRC definition: An organization that is responsible for financial, technical, and organizational management of a production for stage, screen, sound recording, television, webcast, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a moving image production.
MRC definition: A person or organization responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a moving image production

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for creating a computer program.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a computer program

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for publishing, releasing, or issuing a resource.
MRC definition: A person or organization responsible for publishing, releasing, or issuing a resource

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by manipulating, controlling, or directing puppets or marionettes in a moving image production or a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by manipulating, controlling, or directing puppets or marionettes in a moving image production or a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a director responsible for the general management and supervision of a radio program.
MRC definition: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a radio program

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a radio program.
MRC definition: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a radio program

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by supervising the technical aspects of a sound or video recording session.
MRC definition: A person contributing to a resource by supervising the technical aspects of a sound or video recording session

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by using a recording device to capture sound and/or video during a recording session, including field recordings of natural sounds, folkloric events, music, etc.
MRC definition: A person or organization who uses a recording device to capture sounds and/or video during a recording session, including field recordings of natural sounds, folkloric events, music, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a candidate for a degree who defends or opposes a thesis provided by the praeses in an academic disputation.
MRC definition: A person or organization who makes an answer to the courts pursuant to an application for redress (usually in an equity proceeding) or a candidate for a degree who defends or opposes a thesis provided by the praeses in an academic disputation

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent responsible for the set of technical, editorial, and intellectual procedures aimed at compensating for the degradation of a resource by bringing it back to a state as close as possible to its original condition.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for the set of technical, editorial, and intellectual procedures aimed at compensating for the degradation of an item by bringing it back to a state as close as possible to its original condition

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an author of a screenplay, script, or scene.
MRC definition: An author of a screenplay, script, or scene

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an artist responsible for creating a three-dimensional resource by modeling, carving, or similar technique.
MRC definition: An artist responsible for creating a three-dimensional work by modeling, carving, or similar technique

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a former owner of a resource who sold that resource to another owner.
MRC definition: A former owner of an item who sold that item to another owner

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by using his/her/their voice, with or without instrumental accompaniment, to produce music. a singer?s performance may or may not include actual words.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by using his/her/their voice, with or without instrumental accompaniment, to produce music. A singer's performance may or may not include actual words

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by speaking words, such as a lecture, speech, etc.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by speaking words, such as a lecture, speech, etc.ÿ

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent sponsoring some aspect of a resource, e.g., funding research, sponsoring an event.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization sponsoring some aspect of the resource, e.g., funding research, sponsoring an event

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a stage resource through the general management and supervision of a performance.
MRC definition: A person or organization contributing to a stage resource through the overall management and supervision of a performance

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by relaying a creator?s original story with dramatic or theatrical interpretation.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by relaying a creator's original story with dramatic or theatrical interpretation

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a cartographic resource by providing measurements or dimensional relationships for the geographic area represented.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a cartographic resource by providing measurements or dimensional relationships for the geographic area represented

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by giving instruction or providing a demonstration.
MRC definition: A performer contributing to a resource by giving instruction or providing a demonstration

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a director responsible for the general management and supervision of a television program.
MRC definition: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a television program

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a television program.
MRC definition: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a television program

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by changing it from one system of notation to another.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by changing it from one system of notation to another. For a work transcribed for a different instrument or performing group, see Arranger [arr]. For makers of pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac]

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by expressing the original text of the resource in a language different from that of the original resource.
MRC definition: A person or organization who renders a text from one language into another, or from an older form of a language into the modern form

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a performer contributing to a resource by providing the voice for characters in radio and audio productions and for animated characters in moving image resources as well as by providing voice-overs in radio and television commercials, dubbed resources, etc.
MRC definition: An actor contributing to a resource by providing the voice for characters in radio and audio productions and for animated characters in moving image works, as well as by providing voice overs in radio and television commercials, dubbed resources, etc.

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by providing an interpretation or critical explanation of the original resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or corporate body contributing to an expression of a work by providing an interpretation or critical explanation of the original work

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to a writer of words added to a musical resource.
MRC definition: A writer of words added to an expression of a musical work. For lyric writing in collaboration with a composer to form an original work, see lyricist

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a primarily non-textual resource by providing text for the non-textual resource (e.g., writing captions for photographs, descriptions of maps).
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a non-textual resource by providing text for the non-textual work (e.g., writing captions for photographs, descriptions of maps).

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by providing an afterword to the original resource.
Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by providing an introduction to the original resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing an introduction to the original work

RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by providing a postface to the original resource.
Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by providing a preface to the original resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing a preface to the original work

RDA label: has writer of supplementary textual content
RDA definition and scope note: Relates a resource to an agent contributing to a resource by providing supplementary textual content (e.g., an appendix, an introduction, a preface) to the original resource.
MRC definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by providing supplementary textual content (e.g., an introduction, a preface) to the original work
